utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey uh Mon, I saw the Porsche parked out front, can I get the keys? Thought I’d take that bad boy out for a little spin.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wait a minute! You let Ross drive the Porsche and when I ask you, you say you’re the only one who’s allowed to drive it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, well he’s my brother! And plus he drives so slow he could never hurt it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s a car Monica! Not a rocket ship!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Whatever Ross! Just replace the bulbs in the brake lights after you’re done.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Saw the Porsche out there Mon, lookin’ good. When do I get to take that baby out again?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You let Joey drive it?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’ve never driven it! Okay? Not once! Okay once. Okay, I drive it all the time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nice work everybody! So much for the y’know, "You can drive it, but don’t tell Rachel" plan!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! I can’t believe you lied to me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I can fix this! Okay Monica, Rachel thinks all you can talk about is the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Great! Well Rachel, the reason why I won’t let you drive the Porsche is because you’re a terrible driver. There! That wasn’t about the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look Rach if-if you want to go for a ride in the Porsche I’ll be glad to take you for a quick spin around the block.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, you got a couple hours?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whew! That was a brisk ride!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Take the top down did ya?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Only way to fly.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Come on Ross give me the keys! Monica does not know what she’s talking about! I am an excellent driver!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re fast and irresponsible. That adds up to a bad driver.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well in High School, that added up to head cheerleader.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Did you see the look that girl just gave me? Huh? She must’ve seen me cruising in the bad boy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I think she’s checking out your beehive Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! Give-give me a brush.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Gimme the keys!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No way!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well no brush!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine! Y’know what? It doesn’t matter, because, if I remember correctly, there is a comb on the floor of the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Alimony.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, we still haven’t gotten an RSVP from your dad.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh! Right. Umm, maybe that’s because I didn’t send him an invitation.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler! He’s your father; he should be at the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t even know the man. Okay? We’re not the close. I haven’t seen him in years.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well what are you gonna do when he finds out he wasn’t even asked?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well he doesn’t have to know! It’s not like we run in the same circles. I hang out with you guys, and he stars in a drag show in Vegas.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, I think I wanna trade circles.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Trust me, you don’t want him there either. Okay? Nobody is gonna be staring at the bride when the father of the groom is wearing a back-less dress.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So what! As long as he’s not wearing a white dress and a veil I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I think I need to do some shopping.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ahhh! Ooh, nice!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: My God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What do you think you’re doing?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Just washing the windshield.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: There is no way I am letting you drive this car! So why don’t you just hand over the keys?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No ah-ah-ah! Do not start this car! Okay! Okay! I will give you twenty bucks if you get out of this car right now!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look Ross, if you’re so freaked out, just get in the car!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: With you?! Yeah right!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay! Okay! Okay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What are you doing?! Get in the front!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: In the death seat?!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my…

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey sweetie!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! Sure! Ooh, I left my purse up at Monica’s. I’ll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Wait a minute!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What? Oh. Ooh. Whoa! That one kept going.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So! You and Phoebe huh? How long have you been going out?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Over a month.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! Maybe uh, maybe you and I ought to get to know each other a little better.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Sure, I’d like that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So uh, what’s your name?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Its Jake.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Joey. Hey Jake, do you like the Knicks?

utterance.speaker: Jake
utterance.content: Yeah, big fan.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Me too! There’s a game on Tuesday do you wanna go?

utterance.speaker: Jake
utterance.content: Yeah that would be great! Let me make sure I’m not doing anything Tuesday.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Here!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s your suitcase. We’re going to Las Vegas.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you serious?! I mean like eloping?! No more stupid wedding stuff?! No more these flowers or these flowers or these flowers—Think of the money we’ll save!! We’re not eloping. I love the flowers. Can our wedding be bigger please?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We’re going to Las Vegas to see your dad. It’s time you two talked, and I want to get to know my father-in-law.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know we already went over this and I won!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No you didn’t. Oh and honey just so you know, now that you’re marrying me, you don’t get to win anymore.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look forget it okay? I don’t want to go. I don’t want to see him. I don’t wanna.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, look I-I know that your dad embarrassed you. I know…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no all kids are embarrassed by their parents, you’d have to come up with a whole new word for what I went through. When I was in High School, he used to come to all of my swim meets dressed as a different Hollywood starlet. Y’know it’s hard enough to be fourteen. You’re skinny. You’re wearing speedoes—That your mom promised that you would grow into! And you look up into the stands and there’s your dad cheering you on dressed as Carmen Miranda. We was wearing a headdress with real fruit that he will later hand out to your friends as a healthy snack!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, the point is that he was at everyone of your swim meets and he was there cheering you on! Okay? That’s a, that’s a pretty great dad.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He had sex with Mr. Girabaldi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Who’s Mr. Girabaldi?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Does it matter?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, you’re not fourteen anymore. Okay? Maybe it’s time that you let that stuff go. If your father’s not at your wedding…you’re gonna regret it for the rest of your life.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah o-okay, but I’m just doing this for you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So I really never get to win anymore?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How much did ever really win before?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Listen, you know how uh, when you’re wearing pants and you lean forward I check out your underwear?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, when Jake did it I saw that…he was wearing women’s underwear!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know. They were mine.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh. No! No wait, that’s weird!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, it’s not! We were just goofing around and I dared him to try them on.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s weird!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m wearing his briefs right now.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s…kinda hot.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I think so too. And that little flap? Great for holding my lipstick.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, I wouldn’t know about that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And! Y’know what Jake says? That women’s underwear is actually more comfortable. And he loves the way the silk feels against his skin.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah well next thing you know, he’ll be telling you that your high heels are good for his posture!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: There is nothing wrong with Jake! Okay? He is all man! I’m thinking even more than you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah, he looked like a real lumberjack in those pink laceys.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m just saying that only a man completely secure with his masculinity could walk around in women’s underwear! I don’t think you could ever do that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! I am secure with my masculinity.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay whatever.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You’ve seen my huge stack of porn right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: God. I forgot how much I love driving. I have got to get my license renewed.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You don’t have a valid driver’s license—Okay that is it! Pull over right now!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Ross you’re so tense! You just gotta relax okay? Just need to relax all right? Just need to relax…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What-what are you doing?! Are you—Okay that’s not funny! Just stop horsing around!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I am not horsing around okay? I am Porsching around.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, stay calm. Nothing is going to happen to you, you are not in that much trouble.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really? You think so?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I was talking to myself! You’re going down!

utterance.speaker: A Waiter in Drag
utterance.content: Has someone taken your order yet?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh oh yeah, she did. Uh, he did. She? I’m-I’m sorry I’m new. I don’t…

utterance.speaker: Waiter in Drag
utterance.content: Hm-mmm?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I just ordered a beer!

utterance.speaker: Waiter in Drag
utterance.content: You’re straight. I get it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I still say that if we had called your dad we coulda gotten better seats.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! No! I don’t want him to know we’re yet! I’m not sure I’m ready for that. And besides he’s not gonna be too happy to see me either.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why not?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t know if I’ve told you this, but he’s kinda tried to get in contact with me a lot over the last few years

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s made phone calls, written letters, he even came to New York, but I always said I was too busy to see him. Y’know it’s all very Cats in the Cradle—I don’t want to get into it. Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Announcer
utterance.content: Ladies and gentlemen please welcome the incomparable Helena Handbasket!

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: Hello darlings.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And there’s daddy!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Switch places with me! Switch places with me! Come on! I’ll go under, you go over!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll get right on that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh come on Ross!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No Rach! Come on! No-no! Yeah, I’m sure we won’t get arrested for this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi officer, was I going a little too fast?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Can I see your license please?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yes, absolutely! Y’know, it’s weird uh, but I had a dream last night where I was stopped by a policeman. And then he uh…well I probably shouldn’t tell you the rest.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Your license?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes. Here you go Officer uh, Handsome.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: That’s Hanson.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oops sorry, my mistake.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dear Lord!!

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Here it comes.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: This is a great picture.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?! You think so? Y’know, I had just rolled out of bed.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Yeah? Well you look phenomenal.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well she should, it was taken ten years ago!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know you’re-you’re probably wondering about the old date on there.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Yes I am.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: You’re an Aquarius, huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I bet you’re a Gemini.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Taurus?

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Virgo?

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sagittarius?

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I knew it! I knew it, ahh….

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Well I tell you what…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: You’re not gonna speed anymore right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I won’t speed.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: And you promise you’ll get this taken care of right away?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I promise.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: And in the meantime you better let him drive. Does he have a license?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Can he handle the stick?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh well…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I can handle the stick!!

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: I feel pretty. Oh so pretty. I feel pretty and witty and…

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Gay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That can’t be your father.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Believe me, I’ve been saying that for years. Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s Mr. Girabaldi playing the piano.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: For I’m loved by a pretty wonderful boy! Hello! And welcome to the show. I see some of our regulars in the audience. And a couple of irregulars.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He’s coming into the audience. He’s coming into the audience.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Relax! You’ll be fine. Oh much better. You’re invisible now.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: Where are you from?

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Bakersfield.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Bakersfield!

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: No-no I heard! I’m just sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It can’t happen like this. Okay? I’ll meet you back at the hotel.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: Oh look, a standing ovation already! So early in the show. Oh turn around honey; let me see your pretty face.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Can we have our drinks please?! Waiter—Uh, tress!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Check it out. How much of a man am I?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! Nice! Manly and also kind of a slut.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y’know, I’m beginning to see what Jake was talking about.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The silk? Feels really good!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! And-and things aren’t as…smashed down as I thought they were gonna be.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s great Joe!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! And you have so many more choices than you do with men’s underwear!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Bikini, French cut, thong! And-and the fabrics! You’ve got cotton, silk, lace! And y’know what I’ve always wondered about?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pantyhose! Y’know? They way they start at your toe and go all the way up to here… I should go take these off shouldn’t I?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I think it’s important that you do.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: So what’s your name?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: Chandler? What an unusual name! You must’ve had terribly fascinating parents.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, they’re a hoot.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: And who is your friend?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m-I’m Monica.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: Monica! Where are you from?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: New York.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: I’m not very fond of New York. Queens I like. Ooh, what is this sparkle something! Honey! Huh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Actually Monica and I are engaged.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: Really?! Congratulations. When’s the big day?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: In…in two weeks.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: I see. Well, I wish you both a lifetime of happiness. So you’re bald?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wait! Wait! We’d really love it if you could be there.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: We?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know it would make me happy, ma’am.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: Well I wouldn’t miss it for the world. Oh! I’m getting all misty here! You’d think I was having my legs waxed or something.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks for making me do this.

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: Before we go on with the show, I just want to say to the bride and groom how lucky they are to have found each other. In every life, a little rain must fall. Fortunately, in my life… It’s raining men!

utterance.speaker: The Chorus Line
utterance.content: Hallelujah!

utterance.speaker: Helena
utterance.content: It’s raining men!

utterance.speaker: The Chorus Line
utterance.content: Amen!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: When I was growing up I…played the one on the far left.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Remind me to introduce you to someone!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Fourth gear!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! What does he want?! I wasn’t doing anything!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well maybe he saw your hand slip briefly from the ten and two o’clock position.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Maybe it’s uh Sergeant Sagittarius coming back to flirt some more!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s a different guy!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Good evening officer.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Do you know how fast you were traveling back there?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah no. I don’t, but it could not have been more than sixty.

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: You’re right. It was 37.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I mean you’re not gonna give me a-a ticket for driving too slow are ya?

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know of-officer I uh…I had the weirdest dream last night…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: Your license please.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You don’t-you don’t want to hear about my dream Officer…Pretty?

utterance.speaker: Policeman
utterance.content: It’s Petty. I’ll be right back with your ticket.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You have a son!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know. I know.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Feel better?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Much! Listen uh, not that I’m y’know insecure about my manhood or anything y’know, but I think I need to hook up with a woman like right now.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I understand.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Okay! Hey! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y’know, you look familiar. Do I know you from somewhere?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh! Maybe it’s because I’m on television. I’m an actor on Days of Our Lives.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hm-mmm.

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: $4.50 please.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, let me get this. These are for you.
